alert.note: Alert for Carter; Johnston; Marshall; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 9:36AM CDT until July 16 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southeast Oklahoma, Johnston and Marshall. In southern Oklahoma, Carter and Murray. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ardmore, Tishomingo, Dickson, Mannsville, Ravia, Mill Creek, Milburn, Reagan, Russett, Connerville and northeastern Lake Texoma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
